body_html:
There is a quick way to implement a broadcast_to(tensor, shape) function (though not super efficient);

The version using + appears to work on many but not all dtypes:

>>> broadcast_to(tf.convert_to_tensor([True]), (2,)).eval()
TypeError: Value passed to parameter 'x' has DataType bool not in list of allowed values: float16, float32, float64, uint8, int8, int16, int32, int64, complex64, complex128, string
body_text:
There is a quick way to implement a broadcast_to(tensor, shape) function (though not super efficient);

The version using + appears to work on many but not all dtypes:
>>> broadcast_to(tf.convert_to_tensor([True]), (2,)).eval()
TypeError: Value passed to parameter 'x' has DataType bool not in list of allowed values: float16, float32, float64, uint8, int8, int16, int32, int64, complex64, complex128, string
body:
> There is a quick way to implement a broadcast_to(tensor, shape) function (though not super efficient);

The version using `+` appears to work on many but not all dtypes:
```
>>> broadcast_to(tf.convert_to_tensor([True]), (2,)).eval()
TypeError: Value passed to parameter 'x' has DataType bool not in list of allowed values: float16, float32, float64, uint8, int8, int16, int32, int64, complex64, complex128, string
```
